ckNtV76nEiBAxS5pMV5lHg.text: I ordered from this restaurant quite frequently, and I am never disappointed. They have plenty of options, all of which are tasty and healthy! Would definitely recommend this to any newcomers who have driven past it or are just open to try new things. I highly recommend you get the "naked chix" meal super duper delicious and leaves me filled without feeling stuffed.

qIBywV2q14yCLi5XxZZ4eg.text: I want to start off with how much I love the restaurants concept. If you wanna be bad, there's a menu for that, if you wanna be good, then there's a menu for that too.   On this visit, I picked a item that is not on the regular menu board, the big PARM. This is a huge sandwich that you will defiantly need a to go box for. The selection gives you so many choices regardless if which side you order from that you cannot get bored here.  There are TV's with sports on to regular daytime shows so you can chill and watch a game or just hang out. There is an outside dining area so if you want to enjoy the nice Vegas fall season, this is a perfect time for al fresco dining.  I enjoy being part of their juice club as it is easy to get fresh made juices at a reasonable price as juices can get really expensive.   In conclusion, if you on the fence, I would give it a try, its a unique dining experience and I know they are expanding in the valley, my recommendation is the BIG PARM.

CNVFCXBCC1W16MKABR_zJg.text: Would definitely come back here again. I just happened to pass by and picked up a menu to see what this place was all about.  I wanted something comforting so I tried the Spicy Latina Chicken Soup with a Mega Grilled Cheese sandwich. Also ordered the Buffalo Cauliflower. For some reason I thought the cauliflower would be fried or sauteed more but it was still tasty. But the soup and sandwich hit the spot. Wish I had room in my tummy to eat more right now. Yummy....

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Buffalo Cauliflower, Mega Grilled Cheese and Spicy Latina Chicken Soup.....

MH1V9ibOzfnxaBEItgQUYQ.text: This use to be my favorite restaurant. I walked in today and ordered my usual, "The Blaze of Thunder". I waited for my food and checked it as it arrived. I looked at the sandwich and the chicken didn't look anything like what I'm used to or what is advertised. I asked if they forgot the seasoning and she notified me that a recipe change happened. I expressed how it made me felt and she wasn't empathetic, her body language told me she didn't care. Props to the kitchen on cooking the food great, but the customer service from the lobby isn't up to par. If you want a chicken sandwich you're better off going to chick fil-a. You'll save money too and better customer service. I have attached the advertised photo from Skinny fats Facebook for their blaze of thunder and the photo of what I recurved today. I ate my chicken sandwich and was greatly dissatisfied with the lack of spice. The previous "BOT" would give you a runny nose and a slight cough accompanied with a refreshing body feeling. All I got from the "BOT" today was a stomach full of disappointment. The sandwich doesn't deserve to be called "BOT", it is now just thunder.

ZOJSjFeYxsllwI2b-qS7mw.text: I have been to every skinny fats in town multiple times. I absolutely love this place , but this time was awful. The worst it has ever been. I ordered the portobello sandwich with not tomatoes and no avocado, there was tomato guts and a piece of avocado on the bottom bun, normal I wouldn't be this picky but I have a tomato sensitivity and can't stand avocado. I asked for regular fries and there was still hints of truffle oil on them and they were so stale and cold, like they have been sitting in a bowl in the kitchen for an hour. My husband ordered the buffalo chicken wrap on the 420 menu and it had about a pound to much of buffalo sauce in it. It was completely drenched in buffalo sauce. Usually I have nothing but great things to say about skinny fats but today it definitely missed the mark.

3cWM1lclgxtB4OdDIBZIoA.text: Decent food, bad service.  My order has been wrong the last 3 times.  Ordered sweet potato fries and got regular fries. My wife said no tomato or onion and it comes with both.

fKbms6UHFr6PSU8ILwqG0g.text: My friends really wanted to try Skinny Fats, I obliged and came here with them for Lunch. Everything was going good. I ordered, paid and went to get a table. I noticed that I hadn't received a regular size drink only 2 kids drinks. I proceeded to the cashier and politely asked her if she had charged me for an adult drink or just the kids drink? I didn't know since I didn't get a receipt. She told me I had only paid for the kids drinks. I said okay, after you're done with them (My friends that were ordering), can you charge me for an adult drink. She said yes and as I went to pull my wallet out of purse, she slammed the cup down and yelled at me to "just take it!" I don't know what I did to upset her. I took the cup confused, went to my purse pulled 3 dollars out and put them in her tip jar. I'm not asking for charity. I didn't deserve to be talked to in that way. To this day I have no idea what I did to deserve that. For that reason alone I will not be back here.   Out of respect for my friends I made no fuss. I didnt ask to speak to her manager. I waited for my meal, ate and left.  Updated: After my initial one star review, I was messaged by Jennifer (The Manager). She was very kind, asked me questions about the time and date of my visit and apologized for my experience. I appreciate how she took the time to read my review and for that I've updated my review and added 2 stars. The food was good and all the other employees were nice and helpful. I feel better knowing that no one else will be treated the way I was, it was embarrassing. If my friends want to come back here, I'll gladly a company them and give this place another try.

69FufPzNjWJJvK6NC0teiA.text: Love the ambiance!!! Nice little joint with plenty of seating and the staff is very friendly.  The coffee is strong, but good! I love that there are so many options on the menu and good prices. I had the Cluc Moo...delicious, especially when I added Cholula on it! I devoured it! Hubby had the Power Berry (or something like that) waffle, it came with orange agave drizzled with berry sauce, topped with fresh berries and turkey bacon. He really enjoyed it all! The turkey bacon was delicious! I need some of that for home!  We REALLY like this place, wish they had one in Arlington/Mansfield, TX! Hint hint

gqeRQFhIyrdXCVNG1zz_SA.text: After my mom was  recently diagnosed with celiac disease I decided to make gluten-free options more available in my diet. So I work about 5 mins from their N Decatur location & decided to give them a try. First and foremost, the dining room was SQUEAKY CLEAN (the bathrooms were also very well kept) OMFG the Naked Chix bowl was absolutely amazing...so good. I was blown away by the quality of both the food and the customer service. Georgio took my order and there was another worker (a young man who's name tag I forgot to look at!) But he was on the assembly line in front & had my order ready in a relatively quick amount of time. Tiffani helped bag up and hand out my order. All the cooks in the back looked happy to be there & I didnt mean to eavesdrop on them but they were talking about rap/music and comparing artists. I love seeing a happy workplace, especially in the food industry...thats very important to me as a customer to know the staff is productive and happy. Keep up the good work TEAM! I really appreciate you all - this new 'gluten-free' journey had me scared until I had your food! THANK YOU A MILLION TIMES OVER for the support you unknowlying gave me! I appreciate you all!

2gEXDncTbnqB0P9kLsXFmQ.text: I am almost as shocked as you are that this was my first time Dining here. I'm not sure why I put it off so long, perhaps it was due to the fact it was always packed. nlrjnGLzCO1Dn1wzvZND3w.text: I really like skinny fats. I used to eat here more often but after finding out i needed to go gluten free i haven't been as much. The gf options are limited. I pretty much only get the zucc it with grilled chicken. I guess being what they are i imagine more gf options than there actually are. The food is great though!!

qI34VNCEDnXLFLgZfJmezg.text: SkinnyFATS is a really fun place to eat. The menu is divided into the Healthy side and the Happy Side. I have chosen from both sides, my husband and daughter only choose from the Happy side. The menu states the calorie count for the Healthy side, but not for the Happy side. Maybe if you knew how many calories the Happy side had you wouldn't choose much from that side. I don't know. Some people don't care about that when they go out. At any rate, they have something cool for everyone. Sometimes they have items that aren't on the menu. They are on the wall shown on the little TV screens where you wait in line to place your order. This is gourmet type food with non gourmet prices.  The entrees are $7-$14.  My husband likes their soda made with cane sugar. Some people get excited about that. They are interesting flavors, not just the regular coke and sprite type. I don't get the juice because I don't want to spend a lot of money on a drink. The cookies are very good.   In my opinion the best of the Healthy side is the STEAKation. Yummy...really and truly. Last time I ordered something called Pilgrimamedic (not sure of the title). It is just for November. Sooo good. Turkey ham on a waffle made of corn bread stuffing ingredients with fried green beans with some cranberry sauce with an over easy egg on top covered with some hollandaise type sauce and a few sugared cranberries. Wow!  My taste buds were very happy. Not sure what side that was from. Probably the Happy side. I just discovered that they have the breakfast menu all day. I'm going to try that next time.   The decor is interesting. They have TVs which doesn't make me happy. Apparently some people cannot survive without TV every waking hour. The staff are very pleasant and they seem happy which is good. They have some booths, bar seating near the kitchen and a huge table in the middle that multiple parties can sit at with chunky barstools that are hard to move and not extremely comfortable. I'd rather sit at a booth, but they don't have many of those. They also have a little outdoor enclosed eating area. They do have some free standing tables with chairs near the front windows which are not very inviting or cosy.   All in all... this is a fun place to go when you don't want to spend too much money and you have people who have different taste desires. We bring out of towners here when they visit.

ZIePNrZOxKRQj-9g8y_hbA.text: I just love  this spot!!! The selection is so vast! If you desire good quality and healthy choices, then it's on the Skinny side of the menu. If you want a little heavier meal, you can select that from the Fats side! Both taste great  I can tell a lot of work went into this.

The first thing that threw me off was the soda it's not traditional soda I think it's home made and the flavors weren't very good.  The food was ok but not great it didn't really stand it as spectacular. I wouldn't go again.

ceac3Vjebmq5Y5R3mlSkrg.text: I changed the two stars to five stars because the problem was made right in a timely manner. I really appreciate this.  I hadn't eaten at SkinnyFats for awhile. Since I didn't want to have to leave home, I had it delivered. It took a couple of hours to get it. I was quite surprised that it was basically a greasy mess - both the meat on the sandwich and the fries. The only saving grace was that the meat was very flavorful. Even though, I had specifically asked for catsup, I didn't get any. I'm hoping that this was just an aberration and not a new norm for quality.

rsVYnYRcezmZI54rPKM_iQ.text: SkinnyFats has my whole heart! When ever I am craving a juicy burger and fries I come to this place. While this place has a "healthy" and a "happy side" I always stick to the happy side because well ...YOLO!!! So far I have had the classic burger, the cherry poper burger, the chix on broadway sandwich, and the hot chix salad. Out of all of these my favorite has been the chix on broadway sandwich. The sandwich consists of a HUGE tenderized chicken breast, thick cut pieces of bacon, cheddar cheese, veggies, and a fresh lemon herb aioli. The lemon aioli was a suprise but it helped to add a dash of tartness to balance out the rich fried chicken. The portion of this sandwich is extremely large and I had  to share the last bit with my hubby. Pair it with either their truffle or sweet potato fries and you have got a winner!!!! As far as the restaurant goes the employees go out of their way to make sure you enjoy your meal. One time my husband's burger was over done and they quickly prepared him a new one and comped an extra side for him. SkinnyFats is a great place to catch a casual dinner, however I have yet to try their amazingly delicious looking  breakfast menu. It is definitely on my to do list though!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chix on Broadway sandwich with sweet potato fries

Definitely my new go to spot for good food that is good for you!

ppy0vosd8tm5pFLBbFvo8w.text: This place has been on my bucket list for a while. I decided to try since there was free delivery on Door Dash.  I was kinda underwhelmed. I decided to try items off secret and regular menu.  Tortilla Soup- Super spicy, but not much flavor. The chips and cheese on top were tasty. Chicken Taquitos- Dry and bland. The chicken didn't taste seasoned. Thai Burger- the combo of flavors and texture sounded great, but was not executed. The pineapple was the only thing that gave flavor. Bun was fluffy. Hummus- Not smooth, tasted oily. Hint of garlic for flavor  Strawberry Lemonade- Not sweet, no flavor of strawberry. My food arrived hot and well packaged,  but just not feelin it. The names of the menu items were cool and flavor combos pulled me in, but flavor left me hangin. Not sure if I would try again.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-B1MJ54mIz62Oq6YFRJeNQ.text: We went back two days ago, this time with a 12 year old daughter along for the adventure.   Pluses:  Daughter loved the decorations and designs on walls. Wife loved the food options. I loved the food portions served.   Negatives: Daughter: Wanted a Dr. Pepper Wife: Felt it was a little pricey for a place that appears almost like a fast food place. I didn't care for the extra spice on my chicken sandwich,  very powdery on first bites.  Bottom line is we did enjoy the experience.

YUM  Avocado toast was so delicious and had a good taste to it making you want more! The burger was also so good and the fries, omg the FRIES that came with the burger were best fries I've ever had!

giZsFwMjWW1u6qa7zI3ntw.text: What a neat concept!  Two menus, both really good, and get to choose how you order.  Do you want to have a cheat day or do you want to eat more on the healthy side?  Plan accordingly for some extra time needed if you go during standard meal times because it gets busy!  Well worth it though to come in, eat, and relax while watching a game on their TVs.  So far, we tried the SkinnyFats punch, Balls and Goballs for appetizers, Naked Chix and Ahi Taco.  All were amazing!

8fhK6mpyuKhvrWNsTISFIw.text: Love this place! We usually come in for lunch and always order the Naked Chix, but last night (a Saturday), we decided to eat out. Surprised at the line in the entry! But ordering was fast and Julie the cashier was a doll! She greeted us with a smile and enthusiasm, I think she was actually happy to be there! She had great suggestions and explained the menu superbly. We tried some different items than our usuals, so glad we did! We ordered 4 items, drank the cucumber water and spent only $40. Tax included. We had the Avacado Toast, protein Waffle, Thai Cobb salad and the Curry noodles with chicken, YUMMO!!  Can't wait to go back!

lVMefGFQH0bsPYNsLxfv6A.text: We are at skinny fats. Didn't know they served dog. This is NOT a service dog. A service dog would not be sitting next to it's owner on the bench plus it's not wearing a service vest. Another establishment scared to offend someone. Well I'm offended for the staff not saying anything....

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XaSO0lozlkxt25w_vEcOrw.text: At first I wasn't too keen when I ate here the first time, but once I ordered the "More Cow bowl" with an egg over easy the next time around, I've been hooked.  There's a healthy and somewhat healthy sides of their menu depending on what you're in the mood for.  The joint is spacious and very clean and there's an outside patio area if you want some sun.  Overall, there menu is pretty extensive and something for almost everyone depending on your mood.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f7Tr2lisjIlwlGZjcbGjDQ.text: In my mind I refer to this place as FATTYFATS. Even though they fresh press their juice, source healthy, organic foods when they can, and include tons of healthy options, the food is so good that I want to eat all the things when I come here.  This is truly some of my favorite food when I'm in Vegas. No one beats them for quick service. I have not tasted a single dish here that I don't like. Want some curry? Check! Want chicken and waffles? Check and check. Want a grass fed burger? That's a big green check! If you want a killer steak sandwich that is melt in your mouth spectacular? This is the place for you (maybe have two?....It's healthy, right?). Their kids meals are also fantastic since everything is made fresh. You don't get some lame, run of the mill mac and cheese, it's the good stuff. On top of that they have great options for sides like jalapeno cornbread, truffle fries, sweet potato fries and hummus (or as they aptly call it: yummus).   Let's be honest, SkinnyFATS would have won my heart simply because they serve breakfast all day and use food puns in their names (and lots of them...seriously, who wouldn't want to eat something called the Sweet Cheese Us?). Thankfully it won my heart because the food is out of the world as well!

kq8KuHNdKVuBFehrGrSD1w.text: We needed a lunch spot that offered vegan and none vegan options, found this on Yelp and decided to give it a try! We were most definitely not let down. I love that they have healthy options and more hearty options on the menu, the menu is so diverse there is something for everyone. We loved this spot so much we ate here twice within two days!  The Vegewich burger was amazing, I love portobello mushroom burgers and am very picky when it comes to them. This met all my expectations, it was flavorful and filling. The bread they use for the bun is delicious, the sweet potato fries rule. I have never liked sweet potato fries until I tried theirs, they sure do something magical to them.   We still talk about this spot, and rumors have been about that one will be opening near me in SLC in the future. I hope the rumors are True because we will frequent if so!

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuff on curry- vegan
Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegewich and sweet potato fries. Mmmm!
Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegewich, vegan and amazing!

VYXu_hP7NLH5CsSXyTWAtg.text: I'm a pretty dedicated SkinnyFATS fan so I'm always down to check out a new location. This particular one is HUGE inside! At least compared to the original Dean Martin one and Downtown Summerlin. It's located within a strip mall near Costco and features a nice little outdoor patio as well. The set up is easy to follow, you walk in to the ordering counter right away of you and tables are to the right.   As for the food I usually tend to stick to the healthy (yet still very tasty) side. My go tos are the vegwich burger, yummus, the mean bean or the tru-nuts. Everything I've tried is really delicious and they also have a few pressed juices available. It's a perfect spot for those looking to be healthy, or not. They also have quite a bit of vegan/vegetarian options.   They're always a winner in my book and I love to see more locations popping up!

8CO5fqoyMl8yJKM8c4dlpw.text: Thankfully when I eat at SkinnyFATS I feel more skinny rather than fat. I come about once a month usually for lunch on the weekend when I am craving hearty and healthy foods. The lines can get long sometime even out the door, but it moves quickly. Food can take up to 10 minutes to get, but there isn't a need to rush here. I feel a more chill vibe with the communal table in the middle where people can eat next to one another. There are numerous TVs around if that is your thing. Patio seating is a place where I haven't been yet due to the weather.  Service has been consistently friendly. The dishes that I have ordered range from soup, salad, tacos, burgers, AvocaToast, and more. All of which I have been a fan of except the AvocaToast(vegan option). Don't forget to try their catchups and other sauces which you can buy to enjoy at the house.

lmfAQfSJkO6fTQNLOMYQJA.text: Skinnyfats is awesome! I love the choice of healthy or maybe not so healthy dishes. There is also a secret menu with specials or they will make modifications for you.   The location is comfortable for a meal and I'll probably become a regular.  It can be somewhat pricey but worth it for a quality meal that's made quickly. I really like that they bring you the meal and everyone is friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3wkVhO4AhTOGKVdo5jkWSQ.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE their fried pickles, the best thing ever! Really good food, kinda expensive (totally worth it though)

tdEZ6yXi2TKfmRe1NV_wtA.text: Man WAS this place good. I say WAS because it has straight up been frustrating to eat here. The last three time I tried to come for lunch it was soooo busy. Not the dining area but the kitchen. They are now so focused on getting Uber eats Postmates and grub hub orders out the dining experience has gone down hill.  Wish they could do better with the face to face guest experience. This will be the last time we eat here for a long while.  I got the buff chix and I saw the cook toss my chicken in the sauce then throw it into the oven ( the oven I can see from my table) and when I got my chicken it was well over done and dry. Thank you for my almost inedible food. I used to love this place. But bye.

sQgjPcv5eZOiCdMAkLVWow.text: Used Uber Eats yo order my food this time and was super surprised with the quality of food (even ten minutes of delivery time) I ordered the classic. Uber Eats is offering 15$ towards your first order. This is a crazy promotion that sounded to good to be True but I ordered 14.95$ in food and tipped 4$. My total was 3.95$, I paid for it on my card. The delivery man was at my house at exactly the estimated time. It said 12:15, and he was there at my house at 12:15. Crazy how efficient these guys are. I didn't have to talk to one person on the phone. The food was exceptional. For just a classic cheeseburger, it was easily one of the best burgers I have had to date. Will be back, especially if uber keeps doing promos like this. Keep up the good work guys, 5 stars.

k4MMICoOucb-3lqUR-Yzng.text: Free meal on me for anyone who can help ID this entree. For reasons I cannot say, that weekend was a bit of a blur (like the name of my dish). What I do remember is coming in for a fulfilling lunch after a night of festivities. I chose a healthier option for the sake of my nausea, yet my meal had just the right amount of saltiness & savoriness to enchant my hangover (with enough to spare for later in the day). I tried my friend's less healthier options (they got the Buff Chix and the Chickawaffadopolis), both which did not disappoint--fresh and savory with that nice "dirty" feeling to satisfy your stomach after a night of imbibing. To top it off, they have a cool craft beer selection if you haven't had enough, along with a unique hippie ambiance. Whether you're looking for skinny or not-so-skinny alternatives, this place is definitely worth consideration for anyone's morning after.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5gb-WYSSV_c8mPXawL-3Mg.text: We came here because I liked the name; it's clever.  The whole concept is innovative, fresh, artsy and yummy!  I had one of their fresh juices, it was labeled like 3 days old, but it was not expired yet, and it tasted as if someone had just squeezed it. Delicious!!   Their menu is fun- it does lack pictures considering how detail and creative the names sound. You can order at the counter, or you can grab a menu and sit down.   I ordered a sandwich with fruit and my friend ordered their chicken and waffles. She said their chicken and waffles were better than Roscoe's!!  Everything was super tasty, full flavors without overpowering each other.   The coffee! Oh their deserves a paragraph of their own! I usually like to drink my coffee black to get the full taste of this liquid gold. SkinnyFats' coffee is great! Bold, fresh and served in a lovely cup.   The staff is incredible! Prompt, helpful, extremely friendly and knowledgeable about their menu. I will definitely come back and try something else!

Mkd5l2hBgjavr-MlywhdWQ.text: I'm giving 2 star because their cookies tasted ok. Tacos, the worst tacos I've ever eaten. Tacos are supposed to taste like tacos and this were far from that. The hamburger my husband had was flavorless with the texture of cardboard. The sweet potatoes fries were over cooked and I couldn't tell what the taste was like.  We saw multiple people walk in look at the menu and leave. We totally wasted our cheat meal day...

5PY06ZL2tm5HKaIIM5rbLg.text: This fast-casual restaurant has a great vibe-an extensive menu with both "healthy" and "happy" choices, made with fresh veggies and quality ingredients, and they are very eco-conscious, using reusable cups, paper straws, and providing recycling bins. The decor is reclaimed wood- I really like that aesthetic. The food and atmosphere deserve 5 stars. But. I entered and ordered at the counter - a "bleu balsamic" from the healthy side of the board, while my husband made a happy choice(!) along with a side of spicy, yummy "cauliFIRE," we included the requested gratuity (which always seems strange in a place with counter service), then took our number and a seat. My dish came out incorrect, so I walked up to the front to return it and was only told, "you weren't charged enough for that." The server quickly came over and promised to fix it at no charge but then forgot to send in my correct choice until about 10 minutes later (it's an open area, we could see and hear everything). My husband was finished before my food ever arrived, and I didn't receive so much as an apology. I will try again- their food is that good- and will hope this was a one-off as far as customer service is concerned.

CkKe3z_w4z85UH8GqsovVA.text: Very dissapointed, tried to call in an order, amd was told you can't do pickup. So I went to the restaurant and even though I saw 5 employees doing sidework and greeting people, there was only 1 person running the register. After waiting about ten minutes without the line moving, I left. This was at the Decatur location, don't waste your time.

8XahXbUXDIYkKn8n5u-ffA.text: One of my favorite restaurants ever!!! They have new items as well.  I ate the Salmon overboard and the Thai Cobb salad and it was soooo good.  The decor is on point and the staff was super cheerful.  Very happy with my experience.

eos5pSnmAO9PxPbxk2sw0g.text: It was okay it was my first time visiting skinny fat. A friend recommended me to this place so I decided to give it a try wasn't too bad for a first time visit I especially like the chicken very spicy chicken with the sweet potato fries

QLi-WYnXX47iJZi9gBYbkA.text: First time here. The punch is DELICIOUS!! Only reason I give 5 stars is it is a bit on the expensive side. For 3 of us $57.00 dollars! I'll definitely come back for the punch, but it sucks I wouldnt make this a more frequent place I would come for budgeting families.

zW8uCd_kZVPCpAdvNssp8Q.text: The food is delicious, but mostly the service is incredible! The staff is so friendly every time we go here to eat. We live close by and visit often and have never been disappointed! Love the Steaknation sandwich!!

PtIhrIAOI3b2TqXQ_OXVyw.text: Good food and service. Definitely recommend since they both have a regular and healthy menu.

BPJrhTWc_A4GxmxGpGUuCQ.text: Food was great; very flavorful and delicious. But the reason i will return is because of the service. Kate, the cashier, made our first visit a memorable experience. Kate was kind enough to go through the entire menu with us, the popular dishes, and their secret menu. Best customer service i have ever experienced. Thank you Kate, my wife and i will definitely be returning.

O9bx2j3AGwKITXpwwTqleA.text: Very cool interior! Food delicious!! Excellent customer service!

0c93msqCU6AwoUq-HPf1yQ.text: So excited to have a skinny fats on this side of town! Even though it was packed on Monday the staff were super accommodating and offered some free cookies for what they thought was a long wait!! Food was fresh and so good!!

V_zWRHYOMT-hO8Ylh6uDhg.text: The truffle fries are to die for! This location is much bigger than the one on Dean Martin! Thank god it's so much closer to me now!

vqms798HxWLlzy9m0Xh_Jg.text: After a few visits to this restaurant, I can honestly say this has become one of my favorite places to eat. The menu features a "Healthy" and a "Happy" side, making it a great place to eat whether you're on a diet or treating yourself to something nice. I've tried a variety of menu items with my past visits, and I have not been disappointed with any of them. The staff is always friendly and actually seem genuinely happy to be working there. The tables have come equipped with a variety of signature condiments, such as "Chipotle Catchup", as well as regular ones, like Heinz ketchup. As for their drinks, they have a big jug of ice cold cucumber lemon water, and their fountain drink selection isn't the usual Coke or Pepsi products. I believe it was Boylan Bottling, which offers cola, cream soda, and even black cherry soda (my favorite!). Overall, my experiences dining here have been very positive ones, and I would definitely recommend eating here!

jDS_dqiude10lAgTzUQMHQ.text: My family has been to the skinny fats on Dean Martin and were excited to see a location on our side of town. We decided to stop in on a Thursday in hope of a smaller crowd, but to our surprise it was still very busy. We waited about 15 minutes in line to order by the time we ordered we were lucky a family had finished and were able to sit at their table since seating was scarce. My kids ordered shakes and hamburgers. My husband ordered the big parm, and I ordered the nice to Greek you. My kids burgers were the first to arrive to the table along with the big parm. We waited an extra 15+ minutes for the kids shakes which by that time they had finished their dinner. All while I still waited for my flatbread. I honestly thought they forgot my meal but later Alana came to our table to apologize for the wait and refunded my entree. I was hoping they would of worked out their kinks by now but will probably wait a while before we return.

lcCOWfOZ2Pwy_KXbtpxgaw.text: I've eaten here three times since they opened and each time I hope it gets better. It doesn't. First of all, you have to wait in a super long line which they purposely make you wait in because they don't want too many food orders to go into the kitchen at once. However standing there, especially with kids, is not the way they should do business. Their salads are way too expensive for the portion that you get. I had the chicken and waffles today. The waffle was tough and my chicken was soggy. The atmosphere is great and the people are really nice, but the food is very hit or miss. The one positive thing is the cookies are amazing! Even though I got my cookies to go and when I got home they gave me the WRONG cookies. Nevertheless, they were still very good. Hopefully, since this place is still new, they get their act together and fine-tune the establishment and kitchen. I've been to the other two locations and never had a problem with the food.

KWZlo7zhlX3FwuaXBrIf5g.text: This has become one of my favorite Sunday brunch spots!  Firstly, the staff here are super pleasant! They're friendly, energetic and helpful. I totally think the service here rocks when most order and pay type establishments really don't offer much service at all.   The food has been pretty solid. I have favorites on the menu: caulifire, teri-ahi sandwich, smotherload (ask for more sauce!),more cow bowl. And there's always something different on their secret menu, their 420 menu, a different weekend or monthly benedict and Sunday Sundae. What's cool and what sucks about the various benedict and sundaes is that they don't repeat... I've had some favorites (chicken curry benedict called curry underwood, and a carrot cake waffle sundae). I really like the ma the meatloaf sandwich and blaze of thunder spicy chicken that's off menu.   I tried Skinnyfats years ago in the OG location and my impression was pretty "meh" due to execution. What a difference a few years and location makes! I've actually gone back to that location and the SW one.... This one is THE location! The food is cooked better, the staff is more on it. I've been about a dozen times and only had one day that they looked short staffed so they really weren't at fault for that day being subpar.   I'm glad this isn't far from my house! If I don't know what I want to eat I just go to skinny fats

kkMEuHcDJKNTJzgQvWqYcw.text: Great team and creative tasty food! Try the strawberry lemonade! The Sunday desert should no be missed!

gqNWLlF5Z8t0OC7-9XN7zQ.text: I had the Stuff on Curry - superber, my Bog Daddy, he devoured the wake n bacon. I will be back for dessert

jYfOaHeSxlij-BmUNJkA-Q.text: I really just don't think they are as good as everyone says. I mean I like some of their food, but to be honest it is kind of pricey. The menu offering healthy options doesn't actually seem to be all that healthy either. The staff seems nice enough though and I do want to try their juice.

hH4AjtviVOvx2Lb_PHiziQ.text: Redeemed. Was in a pinch and y'all were the only close to Work option with sweet potato fries so I decided to swing by. Greeted as soon as I walked in by a REALLY friendly team member. She offered help with the menu and made suggestions. I am very pleased I gave it another go because these fries are BOMB!!! Thank you for the wonderful experience!

N7L5ziVdm1P0dErpt4DBdg.text: Finally! It's about time the Northside gets some cool restaurants. That means less gas and time wasted traveling across town for this gem of a restaurant.   Unlike the Dean Martin location, this place is much more spacious and have plenty of seating (yes, no more table hogging like savages). Of course, their interior is definitely up to par with their other locations; super hippie and great for pictures! haha. The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgable of the menu so no worries if you have any questions.  Just like their other locations, they provide, vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free options; so this is great for a group of people with different lifestyles.  So here's what my friend and I got: --Salmon Overboard: A cucumber boat with a generous slab of buttery salmon topped with a creamy spicy slaw. Great appetizer or mini entree if you're not too hungry. It comes with 4 pieces and is listed under 'Shareables' in the menu, but honestly I ate it all to myself. lmao.  --Naked Chix: Chicken topped with a mango basil sauce placed on top of cauliflower rice. I've never tried cauliflower rice before but I am quite impressed! Although it tastes nothing like normal rice, it still is a great alternative for those eating low carb.  Altogether, a great first impression of this place! They're about to open an extension called Coldpress Express so I'm definitely looking forward to that!

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Latina // $3.95
Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hippie vibes
Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Naked Chix // $7.95

LnyseEgQ3_H0hy9SuQLkaw.text: Long time Skinny Fat customer and I love their food BUT unfortunately the Decatur location does not hold up to the Skinny Fat standard set by their original location and their Warm Springs location.    To start off with the Balls 2.0 fell short from the ones we had at Warm Springs. They were dry and solid like an over cooked meatball and the aioli sauce fell flat. (Warm Springs did an amazing job on the Balls 2.0)   I also ordered an VG bowl dish that I can't recall the name but it had noodles, curry sauce and topped with fried chickpeas. It sounded amazing but when it came (and after the waitress left) I noticed no chickpeas. Being a vegetarian dish the chickpeas was equivalent to ordering More Cow Bowl and not getting any meat.   Maybe I missed the chickpeas? It's possible. So I rooted around my bowl for a bit like a hungry stray dog looking for a treat but couldn't find any. I asked my wife and she came to the same conclusion soooo I notified the waitress. The waitress was very apologetic and said she'd have the cook make me a side of fried chickpeas on the double. 10 minutes later, my dish getting slightly colder as I sat there patiently waiting as child waits for mom to finish dinner a different waitress/staff member came up to me to advise that they're almost ready.  My wife was finishing up her meal and mine still sitting there flaccid and cold chickpealess when my chickpeas finally arrive. The chickpeas were hot, crunchy and delicious. It would have complimented my meal well (when it was still warm).  My suggestion is to go to the warm springs or the Original location. Save yourself the trouble of a disappointing meal and take the extra drive.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noodles, curry, Vegis but no chickpeas

7a7d2rSd_-wevqrDjFMhkw.text: Recently moved to Las Vegas from California and found this gem on Yelp. I love the concept of having the happy vs healthy menu - I haven't seen anything like that before. The restaurant is clean, the staff are friendly and the food is DELICIOUS. I ordered the Vegwich (portobello mushroom burger) with sweet potato fries and my friend ordered the Steakation (steak burger) with truffle fries. We both loved our orders. There are many other options on the menu I'd love to try so I'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4fw2t--OVIO3LBp-57gESA.text: I'm never disappointed when I come here. They have lots of yummy items on their menu. I always have to get truffle fries. They are amazing, same with the sweet potato fries. They're also very friendly.

fI-WJKpyFgX4d2VX4My1MA.text: I  have been here a number of times and tried several different items on the menu. My favorite comfort food from here is the tomato soup and grilled cheese. Just enough to fill me up. It's a cup of soup which is not a creamy soup but a True tomato soup with lots of great flavor. The grill cheese comes on grilled Parmesan toast with a few different kinds of cheese which gives it really grea flavor. The sandwiches are very large servings which each time I have had half a sandwich to take home. The servers are fantastic and very attentive checking to make sure everything is ok once food is delivered. I have brought my vegetarian daughter here and there was plenty for her to choose from. My son also enjoyed his chicken sandwich when he came to visit. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and I have eaten here for all three and have yet to be disappointed with anything. Prices are ok for what they serve. They also have some great desserts that they offer as well, but I have to be honest, I never have any room left and have yet to try any of them. This is a must try, I don think you will regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

voM9G08NZpe2tXGawowP-g.text: Love eating at this place. Great food and good customer service. The menu has plenty to offer, and if this is your first time ordering at SkinnyFATS, you won't be disappointed.

FOljmuUNDd6d70HkU2uj2Q.text: Nice trendy, atmosphere, reminiscent of Venice Beach. Trendy minimalistic furniture and colorful murals on wood. Then, we get to the food, and it was enjoyable.  My two gripes are that 1. the fillet mignon on the egg whites was tough and chewy, 2. I requested scrambled eggs scrambled SOFT and they were HARD. I never send food back so we just left them.  A for effort and decor C for hard eggs and tough filet mignon.

UZlu81ONts7-RbhfSYPXLA.text: This place looks AMAZING. The art on the walls is bright and just makes you feel happy. Bring your appetite!!! Then order the fried pickles!!! They're amazing! The music is relaxed and the atmosphere rocks.   This restaurant is different from the rest. Check em out! You really can't beat good food, a happy atmosphere, awesome decor, and did I say: DELICIOUS food?!?    I'll be back soon!! This place is very family friendly so bring all of the kids! There's a lot of seating so bring a big group of friends.

Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried pickles with ranch! Yummmmmmmy.

VFXxCc7iYsXcl7k32Wto1w.text: I have to say, I posted a not-very-favorable review of SkinnyFATS not too long ago. I want to take back that review and post a stellar one instead! I went back tonight, with my cousin. We both had a Thai Five burger with truffle fries and we were both very satisfied with our food and the staff! Our food was perfect! The burgers have spicy peanut slaw, fried onion straws, grilled pineapple and pepper jack cheese on a fabulous burger patty served on a brioche bun. The slaw and cheese were spicy but that was well balanced by the grilled pineapple. No condiments necessary!   The staff were friendly and helpful, as always! They hire some of the nicest young, energetic people!  I am so very pleased that the management took my last review to heart and made the changes and improvements required to bring the restaurant back up to their high standards...now I can go back to being a SkinnyFATS cheerleader! Whew!

KjIKsACJ_lzH7_Nh7EVwkw.text: I like the concept of their being a healthy menu and a happy menu. I had the bbq chicken sandwich and hummus with cucumber. It was healthy and filling. If you are looking for a quick bite to eat that is good for you and is decently priced, this is it.

OvJCHgLdp9snA6OrhgxNHQ.text: This SkinnyFats is located in a busy Costco complex but there are plenty of parking in front of the store so that's a plus. The interior is airy with a good amount of seating; the decoration is rustic and hip. The menu has 2 separate sides: healthy and happy (unhealthy). Both sides have plenty of delicious choices from a simple mixed green salad to a fully carbs loaded pasta bowl. My fiance and I got "Nice to Greek you" and "Fresh Morning" and they were both pretty good, except for the "Fresh Morning" was a bit dry and could use a little more sauce. My favorite part about SkinnyFats is that they have Birch Beer as one of their fountain drink selections. This drink is kinda similar to root beer but better and it is so hard to find in Vegas. Overall, I rate this place 4 stars and will most likely come back.

The dude working the register was super helpful, explained a ton to us (first timers) and made some really good recommendations. We were not at all disappointed. I got the cheese steak (i forget the menu name =/) and my fiance got the cherrypopper, and holy sh*t, they were SO good. The cheese steak was actual, tender, juicy, delicious meat, the cheese sauce was to dieeeeeeeee for and the peppers, onions, and shrooms were just ugh. It was SO good! Idk what was on the house salad, but it was absolutely delicious. Simple, but everything you could ever need or want in a side salad. The burger was cooked to perfection, the cheese, the egg, ugh, it was all just DIVINE! The truffle fries were bomb too! Washed it all down with a fresh strawberry lemonade ( you get free refill) that was perfectly sweet and sour. The atmosphere here is also super dope. They have booth seating, outside seating, a community table, and bar style seating. It's super chill, the staff was all super duper nice, and the food was just amazing. I honestly can't wait to go back. Love that they have a healthy side( everything is 600 cals or less I believe) and a "happy" side to the menu too. Before I left, the manager walked up to me and gave me a rather large gift card because they went to the kitchen and it turns out I saved them a days worth of headaches!  Love this place.  TL;DR Awesome, unique food options, great service, clean bathroom.

BdLUbI8mCYBo5TxUXsK8Tg.text: After a few visits, I think I'm in a serious relationship with this place.  The atmosphere is cool, the menu contains more than enough options, and regardless of which side of the menu you order off of (Happy or Healthy), you're going to be stuffed (or leave with a to-go box).  Speaking of the menu, be warned: even if you order off the healthy side, you're going to feel guilty because of how good everything tastes, and probably because of how much you'll end up eating.   Here are a few of my favorites:  try the "S'motherload" burrito (Happy side), the"Sweet Cheese Us" (Happy side) and the "Caulifire" (Healthy side).  They have a nice selection of juices, smoothies and shakes on the menu, but I've always grabbed a soda from the fountain.  By the way, the cups for the fountain drinks are sturdy plastic cups.  You can toss them in the recycle bin when you're done, or take them home.  Skinny Fats even lets you know they're dishwasher safe.  So if you have a need for plastic cups at home, these are keepers.  A few other suggests of information:  for those who want breakfast during non-breakfast hours, they serve breakfast all day.  They also offer a military discount.  When you come in and head to the counter to order, take notice of the display that's about chest level along the wall.  It scrolls specials across the screen for you to consider.  It's definitely worth taking a look to see what's featured there.  This location is in a storefront with lots of parking.  You can strut toward the restaurant with great satisfaction since others in the parking lot will see you headed toward deliciousness, and you can quietly laugh at the people who aren't going to eat what you're about to eat.  I've only been to the Decatur location, but there are three others around town.  I'll try more of them eventually, but trust they're all equally good.  Find the one nearest to you and bring your appetite!

rNntMhmWyFuWSm1H4NvPVA.text: Hubby and I have been here a few times now since they have both a happy side and a healthy side.   Super casual and never packed when we go, maybe because we try to go late night. Cashiers are always helpful since we've had different ones each time we come in and we always ask their opinion on favorites.   Appetizers we've had:  Balls 2.0- AMAAAAZING, don't question just try it. You won't be disappointed   Truffle fries: although big in size, it lacked flavor and zero truffle flavor. I wouldn't say I'm a truffle fry expert, but I have had my fair share.   Main dishes:  Naked chix: really good, hubb's staple dish  More cow bowl: I'm so disappointed that the beef is so chewy, I've ordered the beef dish twice and still chewy so I've given up ordering anything 'filet mignon' mentioned on their menu. Other than that the taste of the dish is pretty good, just a bummer that the beef is such a disappointment.   Turnip taco: good, yet again the beef was such a downfall. Def would swap out for ahi  Ahi srirachi: soo yummy! Has a kick but nothing major, def a good mix of sweet and spicy

w6CLslaaMKV8zJoQ9Cph7Q.text: I love this place! I stopped here for lunch with a large group of colleagues and was able to walk right up, order and seat myself within minutes. I ordered a buffalo chicken bowl with a soda. Starting with the soda, they have really cool re-useable dishwasher safe cups that are sturdy and durable. I kept mine, flew home with it and gifted it to one of my kids who was stoked on the emoji design. While there I had several refills of their cream soda which was delicious! My friends kept stealing sips! Within about 10 minutes my food came out and it was delicious, I threw some hot sauce on there for extra spice and made it just a touch too spicy, but kept quenching my thirst with soda ( I eventually moved on to black cherry soda). My meal was a lot for me, I couldn't finish it all-the portion sizes are ample! I was dining with a vegan friend and there were tons of options for her to choose from, I sampled them all and they were all yummy! The bathrooms are clean and spacious. Best of all, this wonderful food is very reasonably priced, but quality-for-value meal I've had in a long time, if not ever.

photos.caption: Photo of SkinnyFATS - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NvujAvjvJifTc1GoogjBcA.text: Wow, now we got a SkinnyFATS closer to where I live!  Think this used to be the same location that Cici's Pizza was at before...oh well!  SkinnyFATS got me on all kinds of indecision, and it totally affects my ODC.  I mean, it's already hard for me to make a decision on where to eat...let alone what to eat!  So needless to say, it took me a while to decide what I wanted to order.  My family...not so much.  After a brief pause, we ordered:  *T.A.T.S. (healthy) - Turkey bacon, avocado, tomato, spinach and spicy mayo on 9 grain bread  *Cinnutella (happy) - Cinnamon sugar French toast, berries, spiced Nutella, orange agave  *The Big (Bad) Parm (happy & on their secret menu) - Garlic brushed toasted hoagie with breaded chicken, fresh mozzarella and marinara  Overall, good food!  The T.A.T.S was tasty...but would have been 100x better with actual bacon!  Forget the healthy!  Go swiney!  Nice, thick 9 grain bread, lots of fresh avocado and veggies.  Kid was OK with the Cinnutella, but it was hard to distinguish where the actual Nutella was.  Was it supposed to be in that spiced Nutella sauce of sorts?  If so it was light on taste.  The orange agave was good but my kid wasn't too interested in it.  Plus the serving was on the small side for being an actual breakfast entree.  It would have been better with 4 slices instead of just 2.  The Big (Bad) Parm was definitely a BIG sandwich!  Not much in terms of veggies going on here, folks!  Just look at the pic, all I see is red & white!  Carbs, breading, sauce, and more carbs!  But damn did it make me happy!  Crispy garlic bread, fat breaded chicken breast, topped with a load of mozzarella & marinara!  Like an Italian dinner in a bun!  Mangia!  The regular fries and the sweet potato fries at SkinnyFATS were great as well.  Kind of a thinner cut, but fried crisp and easy to eat.  Damn near addictive with their branded ketchups!!  Only issue I have here is that SkinnyFATS isn't exactly skinny on the wallet.  Entree items are a bit on the high side but thankfully for the most part the food is very good.  But don't get me started on those expensive fresh juices!  Near the cost of some actual food!  Wow!  Service for us was friendly, quick, and pretty knowledgeable on both sides of the menu.  I know I asked a lot of questions!  Perhaps on my next visit I'll try something on the healthy side of the menu!  But....maybe not.

Twk1ZhvP3Pry7RiQPY2MRg.text: Food here is always on point! My husband and I have been ordering from here every since we moved to North Las Vegas. We've tried almost all of their sandwiches and the flavors are always great. The smoothies and juices are amazing as well! Always a must when we order here.  But honestly, their cookies are to die for. Sometimes I come here just to get a cookie!  I had to take one star off because they've been messing up on all our orders recently whenever we order delivery through Postmates. They sometimes forget a cookie, or a drink, or some side items. Thankfully Postmates doesn't charge us for the missing items and a manager from SkinnyFATS has even reached out to me.

1IeYV-oGgB5NfWdBQh0xQQ.text: SkinnyFATS is so good. I ordered the buffalo tenders & seasoned fries. Customer service was great. It is a little cold in there. I didn't have a problem except the soda machine area was dirty. Other than that I love it!

VjMIRVvuUcSjt3r-bBVafw.text: Kicked out the old Cici's Pizza and put in a SkinnyFATS...Yes!  Been to several of the SkinnyFATS locs and I have not had anything I did not like except the american fries for breakfast and even those were tasty.  I had the Cherry Popper burger this visit.  A big 1/2 lb beef burger topped with a fried egg, sweet and spicy slaw and chopped cherry and banana pepper  served on a Hawaiian sweet roll.  Very tasty flavors and just enough heat but not overpowering.  The beef patty came out a perfect medium temp and was very flavorful.  They should serve this burger with wetnaps because it sure is messy.    I also had to try the Spicy Latina soup. Yum! like a chicken tortilla soup with chunks of onion, jalapeno's, and chicken in a creamy tomato broth with large thick crispy strips of tortilla.  This dish is very spicy so be careful or you might get burned.    Enjoy!

bLtF2bmHSQlCsWhyOoeIzg.text: I've been waiting for SkinnyFATS to finally open here.  They officially opened yesterday.  Most importantly, I no longer have to drive 30+ minutes to get my SF fix.  Just in case you haven't been to SF, I'll educate you a little.  This is the 3rd location in the Las Vegas.  The menu is separated by a Healthy side (the skinny) and a Happy side (not so healthy). Thus the name, SkinnyFATS.    I've been a fan of SkinnyFATS since day one.  And over the years, I found what I really like here.  I usually order their Wrap Supastar (Chicken & Egg White Wrap).  It's my favorite simply because there's so much protein in it. It taste good too. On this visit, I decided to get something off the happy side of the menu.  I got their Meltdown, which is basically a double meat patty melt.  My patty melt was very good and it came with a side of soup. The overall menu consist of Shareables (the apps), Between the Buns (Sandwiches & Burgers), Tacos, Things in Bowls (exactly how it sounds), and Breakfast (I shouldn't have to explain what that is).  Besides the drinks, the prices are very good and the portions are big.  The line was little slow, but it wasn't due to the staff.  The staff was efficient. There is a lot on their menu and the customers in front of us were just a little undecided.    Just a note...currently, this location has items that cannot be found at the other locations.    Just another note...off the menu items can be found on their TV screens by the register.   Just a final note...I love SkinnyFats' initials SF.    2017 Yelp Review #28

gQe4KT0DSVSf2AEI-Ev8uQ.text: Living in the north part of Las Vegas has meant that we need to drive some distances to our favorite eateries, but 2017 is starting off right with the opening of SkinnyFATS' third location.  Located off of the 215 and Decatur near BestBuy, this is excellent news for us because we don't live too far away at all.  We've been fans since the first SF opened on Dean Martin and now we can become regulars here.    What's so great about SkinnyFATS?  The menu offers up the healthy side and the happy side, so depending on what your diet and stomach wants on any given day, you can find an item to satisfy you.  There are also vegan, vegetarian, and gluten-free options if you need those.  Plus, the staff is friendly and answer any questions you may have about the menu.  Located in an already busy shopping plaza (the Costco side), just head for Massage Envy and BestBuy and you'll find it.  I'm giving you directions this way so you don't drive around in circles.  The interior of the restaurant has the cool murals like the other locations, a communal table, booths, and tables, plus several flat-screens.  The menu here boasts items that the other locations don't have, too.  We had dinner here last night and the joint was jumping.  There was a line to the door for ordering, but I didn't really mind since they did just open and it gave us a chance to peruse the menu.  I went with the Healthy Side's T.A.T.S.:  turkey bacon, avocado, tomato, and spinach on 9 grain toast, skipping the spicy yo sauce because I'm a wimp.  This comes with a side and I decided to get happy with truffle fries:  balance!  It was a great little meal and I'd have this healthier version of a BLT again.  I tried the b/f's Spicy Latina soup side and it was spicy, but very tasty, so try this chicken soup with tortilla strips and pepper jack cheese if you're in the mood. For a first visit at a location that just opened its doors, we left with our Happy Meter reading at "overjoyed."  See you soon, SkinnyFATS.

sy7mqnMyv_85IlZOEpi6HQ.text: IF YOU'RE AN ENVIRONMENTALIST OR ALLERGIC TO PLASTIC THEY DONT ACCOMMODATE TO YOU!    I have gone twice to this location and they are the only restaurant that has given me problems about using my reusable cup to buy a skinnyfats punch. And on top of that they have lied to my face about using my reusable cups, because they say that it's against "health code regulations" but told me that I can bring a skinnyfats cup and get that refilled, so what's the difference? And after I told them that I worked in a restaurant business and that this was False they just give me a blank stare and blame it on their managers. Well here's the proof about reusable cups and it's sad that they decided to lie instead of just charging me and giving me my drink so I can be on my way.   SOUTHERN NEVADA HEALTH DISTRICT 4-409 Returnables for Refilling 4-409.11 Cleaning and Sanitizing Procedures (B) May, if the container is free of visible dirt or FOOD residue, be refilled for immediate return to thecustomer, provided that the act of refilling does not pose a RISK of CONTAMINATION in the FOOD service area. Examples include, but are not limited to:(1)Cups to be refilled at customer request with coffee or soft drinks. (2)"Growlers" or other containers to be refilled at customer request with beer. (3)Containers provided by customers for refilling with water at self-service VENDING MACHINES.  I even brought a mason jar with the OZs on the side of the it so they wouldn't have a hard time figuring out the difference from their 16oz cup on a mason jar.

tY4bDn5d5UxUq_LQoL2zPQ.text: This location is beautiful. I'm in love with the art on the walls, the lighting, and the natural wood features. The way food is ordered and served is pretty cool too, although it is kinda awkward to stand around for a table if there aren't any ready to sit at.   The service here is excellent! From the cashier to the food runners to the bussers, everyone was super friendly and accommodating.   I got the vegan blue berry yum yum French toast and the avocado scramble.  -French toast was not very good but it was edible. I think they're doing too much with it and could easily simplify the whole dish to make it better.  -The avocado scramble I was actually really looking forward to because I dig a good tofu scramble and I make them for myself all the time. However, it was gross. Over powered by turmeric and garlic, I couldn't eat it. Tone down the spices please!   The staff was VERY understanding that I didn't like my food and offered to remake the dish or make me something new. I just got a juice (hangover) instead and that was really yummy.   My boyfriend got the steakation and LOOOOVED it! The hummus that came out with his burger on the other hand was not so loveable... him and I both tried it and weren't into it and we've tried a lot of hummus.  Not giving up on you though, Skinny Fats! I'll try something new next time.

zqXs2zuerPJz4Y7qeCAqNw.text: This was our first visit and we will be regulars from now on! The food is fantastic. The burger I had, the Meltdown, was sincerely the best I've ever eaten. My son had the Sweet Cheese Us and said the marinated steak was amazing. I can't wait to go back and try everything else.  The staff were as incredible as the food. So friendly, full of information, attentive to any needs you have...I could go on and on. The atmosphere is friendly and fun.  The decor was, for me, wonderful. Very environmentally friendly. Bar stool bases were made from recycled palates, walls covered with reclaimed wood, and the cups can be taken home (dishwasher safe), or you can put them in the recycle slot. Even the sandwich skewers were wood instead of plastic.  There's something for everyone here, whether you want fish, turkey, chicken, beef or salad. Decadent healthy and yummy sinful fried food too. This place has an amazing concept, fabulous food, and fantastic staff. YOU'LL LOVE IT!

SJGRev4ziCFymVdQfIeCPg.text: Went to this location about 2 weeks ago, and it was BUSY. The line to order food was out the door.   I ordered the One-Eyed Monster, Two-Nuts, and Truffle Parmesan Fries. The cashier was really friendly and patient, and engaged in some light conversation while my credit card was processing.   The wait for the food was average, didn't take too long. Taste was good, overall. My FAVORITE thing from my order was the One-Eyed Monster. For $4.95 it's a good size (well, snack size, for me) and a quick breakfast bite. Presentation was cute too. The Two-Nuts was OKAAAY. Presentation was nice, but eating it was hard. The cucumber boat it came in was pretty hard to cut through, and made all the contents spill out, so I ended up just cutting it all up and mixing it together like poke. I love fries, so that's pretty standard, but my fries were not hot when I got them. A little disappointed, but I ate them anyway.   The other reason I am giving them only 3 stars right now is because they don't accept phone orders at this location. I'm not sure if it's because it's new, or whatever, but REALLY? Why no phone orders? I may have to edit this if they change their mind. I know I'll be back to this location because it's closer than any of the others, but only due to the lack of dining options in the area.
